level.text: After the Mayor determines that a TANF applicant or recipient may be considered for POWER eligibility, pursuant to § 4-205.72, the Mayor shall provide a medical review of the applicant or recipient to determine whether the applicant or recipient is incapacitated.

After the Mayor determines that a TANF applicant or recipient may be considered for POWER eligibility, pursuant to § 4-205.72a, the Mayor shall provide a review of the applicant or recipient to determine whether the applicant or recipient is eligible for POWER.
The applicant or recipient shall cooperate with obtaining the medical review as a condition of eligibility for POWER.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: The 2012 amendment by D.C. Law 19-168 added "pursuant to § 4-205.72" in (a); and added (a-1).

level.heading: Temporary Addition of Section
level.text: For temporary (225 day) addition of section, see § 4(h) of Self-Sufficiency Promotion Temporary Amendment Act of 1998 (D.C. Law 12-230, April 20, 1999, law notification 46 DCR 4143).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 12-241
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 12-241, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 4-201.01.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Section 5163 of D.C. Law 19-168 provided that § 5162 shall apply upon certification by the Chief Financial Officer that sufficient revenue is available in the June 2012, September 2012, or December 2012 revenue estimates to fund section 10002(a)(1) and (2)(A) of D.C. Law 19-168.
